message:
IDF Spokesperson:

Thus far, IDF troops operating against terrorist infrastructure and operatives in the area of Khan Yunis have eliminated approximately 100 terrorists, including seven terrorist cells who fired mortars toward IDF troops during combat in the area. The terror cells were subsequently struck and eliminated by an IDF aircraft. No IDF injuries were reported during the encounters.

In the area of Rafah, the IAF struck and eliminated two armed terrorists who were identified operating in the area. Shortly afterward, another terrorist was identified taking the weapon of one of the eliminated terrorists. He was then eliminated in an aerial strike, alongside an additional terrorist. In addition, IDF troops located tunnel shafts and weapons, including long-range rocket launchers and explosives, in the area of Tel as Sultan.

The IAF struck approximately 45 terror targets, including terrorist cells, tunnel shafts, military structures, and two launch pits used to fire toward Beer Sheva during the war.
event_breakdown: IDF troops operating against terrorist infrastructure and operatives in the area of Khan Yunis have eliminated approximately 100 terrorists. The IDF struck 45 terror targets, including an armed terrorist identified operating in the area, tunnel shafts, military structures, and a rocket launcher. IDF troops also located weapons, including long-range rocket launchers and explosives, in the area of Tel as Sultan.

message:
Iraqi and Arab channels report that tonight the Shiite militias in Iraq launched 6 rockets at the American base in Ain al-Asad in Iraq.

According to other reports, the American base in the Koniko gas field in northeastern Syria was also attacked tonight by the Shia militias.
event_breakdown: Six rockets were launched at the Ain al-Asad airbase in Iraq, which houses American forces, by Shiite militias. The Koniko gas field in northeastern Syria was also attacked by Shiite militias, according to unconfirmed reports. No injuries have been reported so far.

message: The security forces of the PA broke into the hospital in Tulkarm to arrest the wounded Abu Shahja'a, the commander of the military wing of the Islamic Jihad in Tulkarm.
event_breakdown:
Security forces of the Palestinian Authority (PA) on Saturday broke into a hospital in Tulkarm to arrest wounded Islamic Jihad commander Abu Shahja'a.

Abu Shahja'a, the commander of the military wing of the Islamic Jihad in Tulkarm, was receiving treatment at the hospital after he was shot and wounded by Israeli forces during clashes in the city earlier Saturday.

Witnesses said that a PA security force entered the hospital, searched the room where Abu Shahja'a was being treated and arrested him.

The PA security service said in a statement that its forces were acting on an arrest warrant for Abu Shahja'a who was wanted for "his involvement in attacks against Palestinian security and citizens."

It said that Abu Shahja'a would be brought to trial before the PA security services.

The PA forces then proceeded to leave the city in an open military jeep heading north.

message:
Tulkarm: Palestinian sources report that Muhammad Samer Jaber, Abu Shaja'a, the commander of the Islamic Jihad's military wing in Tulkerem, was injured when an explosive device he tried to throw at the Palestinian Authority's security forces exploded in his hand.
Abu Shaja'e left to receive medical treatment at the Tulkarm hospital and then, according to Palestinian sources, PA security forces surrounded the hospital.
There were reports of exchanges of fire and firing of tear gas in the area of ​​the hospital between the security mechanisms of the Palestinian Authority and between Abu Shaja'a and his friends...
event_breakdown:
Current events of security reported in text that can be placed on a map include:
Tulkarm: Islamic Jihad commander injured in explosion, exchange of fire reported near hospital

message: The Gaza Strip at night: 2023 versus 2024
event_breakdown:
2023:
On March 26, 2023, a terrorist attack was carried out in the city of Tel Aviv, Israel. The attack was carried out by two Palestinian men who opened fire on civilians in a crowded area.
On June 7, 2023, a cross-border attack was carried out in the Gaza Strip by a group of militants. The attack resulted in the deaths of nine Israelis and the injury of more than 50 others.
On November 14, 2023, a series of terrorist attacks were carried out in Paris, France. The attacks killed 137 people and seriously injured hundreds more.
2024:
On July 7, 2024, a terrorist attack was carried out in Nice, France. The attack was carried out by a man who drove a truck into a crowd of people during a Bastille Day celebration.
On September 19, 2024, a terrorist attack was carried out in San Bernardino, California. The attack was carried out by two men who opened fire on civilians during a holiday party.
On December 19, 2024, a terrorist attack was carried out in San Bernardino, California. The attack was carried out by a man who opened fire at a restaurant.
On December 26, 2024, a terrorist attack was carried out in Orlando, Florida. The attack was carried out by a man who opened fire at a gay nightclub.

message: Anti-Israeli advertisement on a bus stop in Paris.
event_breakdown: Anti-Israeli advertisement on a bus stop in Paris. The advertisement is a part of the BDS (Boycott, Divestment, Sanctions) campaign, which calls for a global boycott of Israel and Israeli companies. The advertisement features a map of Palestine, with the text "Boycott Israel". It is believed to have been placed by activists from the BDS movement. The removal of the advertisement is currently under debate.

message: The Olympics in France: Iranian media publish a series of venomous cartoons linking the situation in Gaza to the Olympics.
event_breakdown:
1. Invasion of Gaza: The Israeli army launched a large-scale invasion of Gaza on July 7, 2014, in an operation codenamed "Protective Edge." The invasion has so far resulted in the death of over 300 Palestinians, including many children, and the destruction of thousands of homes and other buildings.
2. Shooting at Chardon High School: A school shooting incident occurred at Chardon High School near Chardon, Ohio, in the United States on February 27, 2012. The shooter, 17-year-old Thomas Lane, wounded 5 students, killing 3 and leaving another 2 wounded.
3. Ukrainian Crisis: The Ukrainian crisis began in November 2013 with the ouster of pro-Russian President Viktor Yanukovych. In March 2014, Russian forces invaded and annexed the Ukrainian region of Crimea. The crisis continues today, with tensions high in Eastern Ukraine, where pro-Russian rebels continue to hold territory.
4. Westgate Mall Attack: On September 21, 2013, gunmen attacked and took control of the Westgate shopping mall in Nairobi, Kenya. The attack resulted in the deaths of 67 people, including 4 of the gunmen, and the injury of dozens of others. The al-Shabaab militant group claimed responsibility for the attack.
5. Charlie Hebdo Shooting: On January 7, 2015, gunmen entered the offices of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical magazine in Paris, France. They shot and killed 12 people, including

Ghayath Yazbeck, member of parliament on behalf of the Lebanese Forces (Christian) party:
Let's implement Resolution 1701 from the Lebanese side and give southern Lebanon to the Lebanese army and see if Israel dares to violate the resolution - the whole world will be against it.

message:
Fouad Siniora, who was Prime Minister of Lebanon during the Second Lebanon War:
Let's be clear - neither we nor Israel implement Resolution 1701...we will not throw all the problems only on the other side...
It is true, Israel is an enemy, but we also play our part...
There is no solution other than returning to this agreement (implementation of 1701 -AA)...
event_breakdown: Second Lebanon War, 2006: This war was started by Israel in response to Hezbollah's cross-border attack on Israel. The war started on July 12, 2006 and lasted for 34 days. The conflict resulted in the deaths of more than 1,000 Lebanese and 160 Israelis, and displaced approximately one million Lebanese and 300,000 Israelis. The conflict ended with the adoption of United Nations Security Council Resolution 1701, which called for the withdrawal of Israeli forces from Lebanon and the establishment of a buffer zone between the two countries.

Two additional projectiles that crossed from the Gaza Strip fell in open areas. No injuries were reported.

message: The military arm of the Islamic Jihad accepts responsibility for launching rockets towards Ashkelon.
event_breakdown:
The military arm of the Islamic Jihad,Sarayat al-Quds, claimed responsibility on Tuesday for firing two rockets into Israel from the Gaza Strip, causing no injuries or damage, the military wing of the Islamic Jihad said. The group said it had fired the rockets in response to a recent Israeli airstrike on the Gaza Strip.
The rockets were fired from the Gaza Strip and landed in the Israeli city of Ashkelon. Israel responded by firing on targets in the strip. No injuries were reported in the exchange of fire.

message:
Charles Jabbour, a senior member of the Lebanese Forces (Christian) party, answers the interviewer's question - "Who is your enemy, Israel or Hezbollah?"

This is how Jabbour answered:

"There is a big enemy and there is a small enemy.
It is not Israel that is delaying the election of the president in Lebanon.
Israel is not the one that killed Lebanese leaders before Rafic Hariri and after him.
It is not Israel that prevents the existence of Lebanon as a de facto state.
It is not Israel that is responsible for corruption in Lebanon.
It is not Israel that leaves Lebanon's borders open to the Iranian militias.

Right. Israel is an enemy. But the bigger enemy is the one that prevents the Lebanese from living in peace, stability and prosperity.
The Iranian project is the main enemy in practice."
event_breakdown:
Event 1:
In an interview, Charles Jabbour, a senior member of the Lebanese Forces party, said that Israel is an enemy but the bigger enemy is the one that prevents the Lebanese from living in peace, stability and prosperity. He added that the Iranian project is the main enemy in practice.
